intro: Ecbolium orchioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to southern Africa. It typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. The plant produces slender, erect stems with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, often with a faintly colored lip. Ecbolium orchioides is a relatively uncommon species, with limited distribution and specific habitat requirements.
